comment: I took this online for Maymester. Very easy and very little work. Daily open-book quizzes that you can take TWICE! (Hint: Google the quiz questions and you'll find sites that list the questions and answers.)

Maymester.Lots of information.Made the class more interesting by using radio podcasts, video clips, and class discussion. Pinpointed review questions to do as hw for exams. Hard to understand sometimes but he will repeat. I'd recommend him

Took it for maymester and it was A LOT.  He gives you way too much information to study and it can be overwhelming.  For so much information he didn't narrow down the information enough to study effectively for the class

This was an amazing class. I think Professor Giraldo was probably the best teacher I ever had. He was extremely helpful and knowledgable about what he wanted from us. I took this as a maymester class, so he made it as interesting a he possibly could.If you pay attention and study the maps and key terms he gives you...you are good to go! :)
what did he just say.....?  other than that,  he was pretty cool.  pretty easy class as long as you go over the material before the tests and pay attention in the lectures.

I've had him for 3 classes and one more to go next semester. By far not my favorite teacher. I have yet to figure out how he got his PhD and still can't pronounce words. Tests are hard, basically straight from the powerpoints. I haven't read A book in his classes. He also doesn't explain things well.. I was on facebook the majority of the class.

He mas no hay bean speaking inglich por manny jeers.There are several map quizzes, and a couple of exams(I took him for May Mester though).I sailed through the class, but a lot of people were struggling.Questions on the exams were at times tricky or random, more like a higher level class,not intro. Probably won't take him again. Cool guy though.
Dr. Giraldo is a good professor who made the class fun.  His accent is no problem to understand.

good guy, easy class therefore I thought his teaching style was easy. I took it during maymester and he seemed a bit thrown by the quickness of it all. Tests were easy and stated exactly what he said would be on them.

Mr. Giraldo was great! I took the basic geography class as a may-mester but I wish now I could have taken him for a full semester. He was very interesting and knew how to change things up a lot so I never got bored. The tests were easy and all the questions were covered in class. I would take him again any time!

I'm not really sure about these other posts but I loved this class. Everything on his exams were from his powerpoints and  we had many days of activities such as making weather charts and so forth. He was smiling and in a great mood each day of class. His accent is easy to understand and I would recommed him for any other Geo course.

He can't teach at all.  Even if you go to his office for help, he has to explain it 4 or 5 times to make it somewhat comprehensible.   He has his PhD in the subject but can't talk about it and is frequently stumped by questions.  All said below and at UGA is 100% true. All who passed had to teach themselves or have other profs to  teach them.
Worst teacher I have ever had!! I had to take his class because there was not other teacher teaching this class. GIS majors avoid this teacher if you can!

Don't take this man for any class.  You will learn nothing.  He tells you material won't be on the test so don't study it and then tests you on it.  This is his MO, see his UGA ratings.  He is a nice guy until you ask questions in class then he gets mad. Students didn't ask him questions because of that and because they were so lost they couldn't.
